intro: Scyphogyne burchellii, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Scyphogyne burchellii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
